comments.author: lisaiscooking
comments.content: Love the idea of the ground, broiled cheese! That could be used all kinds of ways. I'm leaning toward appetizer for this, but it could go either way.

comments.author: veggiebelly
comments.content: Wow! I'm loving the onion rings! What a great idea to put cheese in the batter! Where do you buy xanthan gum?

comments.author: Sheilah
comments.content: "Question: appetizer or dessert?" How about the cheese course AND dessert?! Either way, definitely at the end of the meal, I think. After all those lovely complex flavors, anything else would be anti-climactic.

comments.author: Fredd Amoureuse
comments.content:
yummy ! my grandma is making similar onion rings, each time i try them they make me eat my fingers lol.
Seeing that tasty pic , thinking about the afternoon breakfast...im kind of drooling .
When i got free time , would buy the products and give them a shot. The recipe dont seem to be hard to be done.

comments.author: The Hungry Mouse
comments.content:
Oh my goodness, this sounds heavenly! (I'm a huge fan of Guinness floats with chocolate ice cream...kind of a similar beast.) Yum!

+Jessie

comments.author: Dawei
comments.content: Sounds delicious, what pity I am a vegetarian who doesn't eat eggs. Any idea how I can make them without eggs?

comments.author: axel g
comments.content:
Great recipes!

Stout chocolate malt is a classic...

comments.author: L.Minter
comments.content: We used a mixture of cheddar and parmesan and it was incredible!
